job.title: Software Engineer
job.industry: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing,Information Technology and Services,Computer Software
job.description:
This position is responsible for contributing to the software codebase that StoneAge has created and maintains. This includes but is not limited to developing new features, supporting training, resolving bugs, and managing deployed infrastructure in cloud platforms
Further, this position collaborates cross-departmentally with the marketing, sales, finance, IT, and operations teams on matters of mutual concern. This includes assisting in interviewing technical positions, conducting trade studies, and making recommendations on technology selection and integration, as well as provide support in outside consultant selection and management. As a part of larger initiatives, this position requires the ability to provide candid feedback on timelines, risks, and capabilities.
Essential Functions
Product Design Responsibilities
Design system architectures and assess functional feasibility.
Work with cross-departmental teams to identify and develop user experience goals.
Conduct cost/benefit analysis on technology selection and needs.
Manage influx of data from smart systems and effectively store and manipulate for analytics.
Develop and define state diagrams for software and firmware products.
Create user interface mockups on constrained displays for a positive user experience.
Create script specifications, test plans, and other technical design documents.
Work closely with firmware development and integration teams to ensure consistent approach to software, firmware, and hardware components of a system.
Resolve issues and concerns with cross functional teams including engineering, supply chain, manufacturing, and/or service.
Participate in the requirement development process for new products via end-user interface, and collaboration with the Business Development, Marketing and Engineering Teams.
Write clean, concise, annotated code per design requirements – review and collaborate frequently.
Maintain existing software including fixing bugs, updating packages, and managing deployments.
Estimate deployment costs and time requirements for new products and custom products – execute new product development to cost and time targets and communicate cost vs. feature conflicts early in the design.
Perform design and architecture analyses and perform SDET tasks when appropriate.
Work with Purchasing, Outside Vendors and Internal assembly as prototype parts are fabricated. Verify code compatibility and easily implementation.
Prepare and facilitate software design reviews. Incorporate feedback into designs as permitted given product requirements and project schedule.
Product Test Responsibilities
Write test code to evaluate software firmware and modes of failure.
Draft test plans and perform testing for evaluating the performance, safety and reliability of software and embedded designs.
Develop standard test methods for software and product conformance.
Review and evaluate field-tests and customer feedback on field tests to improve product.
Accompany new products on field tests, operate the equipment and/or software, train others, and document feedback.
Product Support And Transition Responsibilities
Prioritize and triage any customer reported bugs
Develop workarounds to allow customer job completion
Create and deploy patches to production code
Support bug fixes, enhancements and tuning for performance and usability.
Train end-users, Dealers, and StoneAge Staff on proper operation, features, and functions.
Assist deployment, testing, and training associated with new products.
General
Maintain real-time communication regarding project status, obstacles, key design decisions and schedule with Director of Engineering and interdepartmental teams.
Develop designs and concepts that are consistent with requirements – review and collaborate frequently.
Track and record engineering time, by project, using timekeeping software.
Identify and communicate patentable technology during the creation of new products.
Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree in Software Engineering (or equivalent) from an accredited college or university.
2+ years of relevant software design experience.
Expert-level knowledge of Javascript.
Experience with Python
Experience with NodeJs
Experience with React or some similar web framework.
Practical experience in data storage applications for embedded and cloud solutions.
Experience leveraging and integrating third-party libraries.
Able to create exceptional cross-platform user experiences.
Knowledge of modern software version control practices using git or a similar version control system.
Exhibit a positive attitude, high emotional intelligence, and a commitment to being a team player
Possess strong communication and presentation skills with the ability to adapt approach and level of technical detail to reach diverse audiences effectively
Be able to communicate and interact effectively with management and team members at all levels through both verbal and written means.
Be able to learn and understand StoneAge’s product lines, customers, market segments, and services
Be a self-starter that demonstrates initiative and ability to work both independently and collaboratively
Be a creative and strategic thinker with excellent problem-solving skills
Be customer service driven.
Ability to plan, multi-task, and manage time effectively
Be committed to furthering the waterblast industry in safe and effective work practices
Embrace and demonstrate the StoneAge “OWN IT” mindset and behaviors daily Be a good teammate, practice self-leadership, and deliver on the StoneAge Assurance Promise
Desired
Experience with analysis and extrapolation of sensor suite data.
Development experience in Python, Bash, or other scripting languages.
Prior use of a Javascript framework such as React or Vue.
Experience with Mongo
Experience with AWS
Experience with Node JS
Experience with remote data acquisition for post processing and graphical representation.
Experience in industrial software market.
Experience in product research and development.
Mechanical aptitude to understand implementation of theory to cyber-physical systems.
Other Information
Travel may be required.
We will consider candidates who want to work remotely, but regular visits to our Durango headquarters will be required so we will give priority to candidates who are either in the Durango area or live in proximity.
Extended working hours may be needed at peak times or when short staffed.
Must be able to lift heavy loads using proper lifting techniques as outlined in the StoneAge Employee Handbook.
Follow all Safety Protocols outlined in the StoneAge Safety Handbook.
Familiarity with Waterblasting safety standards and protocols is desirable.
We value the diversity of the people we hire and serve. Diversity at our company means fostering a workplace in which individual differences are recognized, appreciated, respected, and responded to in ways that fully develop and utilize each person’s talents and strengths.
This is an exempt, salaried position. The starting salary range is between $80,000-$110,000, depending on experience.
Benefits
StoneAge offers a comprehensive benefits program that includes group health, dental, and vision insurance, life insurance, long-term disability insurance, paid time off, paid holidays, a 401(k) plan with a guaranteed match, paid parental leave, a wellness rewards program, and much more.
We are an employee-owned company with profit-sharing and an Employee Stock Ownership Plan ("ESOP"), in which shares of company stock are allocated to eligible employees each year.
Our "Own It" mindset captures what many of us consider the biggest benefit of all a highly engaged, collaborative workplace where everyone matters and every employee has a huge impact.
